section.name: FILM IN RESIDENCE: Film Culture in Residence

comments:
This course gives a flexible, immersive cinema studies experience, intended to introduce students to a wide range of films and provide experience speaking and writing about the art form. Screenings occur once a week and are followed by discussion. Participation to all regular meetings is mandatory; no exceptions are allowed.

The response to this course was overwhelming positive; all students remarked that it was fun and informative. According to one student, “The breadth of films is… incredible and enlightening.” Another student agreed, adding, “I had no knowledge of the Oscar Awards before this…From this class, I was exposed to different types of films [that have made] my mind think differently.” One student summed up the consensus, saying, “This is a great program for expanding your knowledge of the types of film you’re exposed to.”

Students agreed that Professor Donovan is “very knowledgeable and clearly loves the course.” Many other students remarked that Professor Donovan was a favorite and one of the reasons they enjoyed the course so much.

According to student response, the time commitment for this course is very low. Several students described it as “really laid back” and “low-commitment.” The course includes a presentation at the end of the semester.
